qas.question: What is another name for anthracite coal?
What helps to preserve ecosystems in the Appalachians?
What kinds of fields are in southwestern Kentucky?
Which part of Ohio has the metamorphosed form of coal?

context: The Appalachian Mountains contain major deposits of anthracite coal as well as <b0_0>bituminous<b0_0/> coal. In the folded mountains the coal is in metamorphosed form as anthracite, represented by the Coal Region of northeastern Pennsylvania. The <b2_0>bituminous coal<b2_0/> fields of western Pennsylvania, western Maryland, <b3_0>southeastern<b3_0/> Ohio, eastern Kentucky, southwestern Virginia, and West Virginia contain the sedimentary form of coal. <b1_0>The mountain top removal method<b1_0/> of coal mining, in which entire mountain tops are removed, is currently threatening vast areas and ecosystems of the Appalachian Mountain region.
